detail.title: Action Details
detail.selectHint: Select an action on the left to see its details.

caution.title: Caution
items: Recognition may be reduced in low light.
Keep your hands within the camera frame.
Perform motions slowly and with clear, large movements.
Combination gestures must be held at the same time to be recognized.

gestures.name: OPEN_PALM
howTo: Face your palm toward the camera
Move slowly near the center of the frame
tips: Moving smoothly with your whole arm improves stability.
pitfalls: If your hand leaves the frame, the cursor may stop.

gestures.name: PINCH
howTo: Pinch firmly with your thumb and index finger
Hold longer to drag
tips: Don’t move too fast while dragging.
pitfalls: A weak PINCH may cause missed clicks.

gestures.name: V
howTo: Spread your index and middle fingers to form a V shape
tips: Keeping a wider V angle improves recognition.
pitfalls: If fingers overlap, recognition may become unstable.

gestures.name: FIST
howTo: Keep a clear fist shape
Position your hand near the center of the frame
tips: Recognition is more stable when fingers are fully folded.
pitfalls: A half-closed hand may be misrecognized as another gesture.

gestures.name: V
howTo: Spread your index and middle fingers to form a V shape
tips: Keep a wide V angle.
pitfalls: If the angle is too narrow, it may be misrecognized as PINCH.

gestures.name: OPEN_PALM
howTo: Keep your palm open
tips: Don’t move too close to the camera.
pitfalls: If your fingers bend, recognition may become unstable.

gestures.name: PINCH
howTo: Pinch firmly with your thumb and index finger
tips: Hold the pinch for at least 0.2 seconds.
pitfalls: If you release too quickly, it may not be recognized.

gestures.name: PINCH + FIST
howTo: Make a fist while maintaining PINCH
tips: Both gestures must be held at the same time.
pitfalls: If performed sequentially, it may be recognized as a single gesture.

gestures.name: PINCH + OPEN_PALM
howTo: Open your palm while maintaining PINCH
tips: Keep the hand shape large and clear.
pitfalls: If fingers fold, only PINCH may be recognized.

gestures.name: PINCH + PINCH
howTo: Hold the PINCH state firmly
tips: Apply a clearly noticeable pinch pressure.
pitfalls: If too weak, it may be treated as a single PINCH.

gestures.name: PINCH + V
howTo: Make a V gesture while maintaining PINCH
tips: Keep a wide V angle.
pitfalls: If timing is off, it may be recognized as a direction input.

gestures.name: LEFT FIST + RIGHT OPEN_PALM
gestures.trigger: Hold left-hand FIST + move right-hand OPEN_PALM
howTo: Keep your left hand in a clear FIST continuously
Open your right hand (OPEN_PALM) and move it slowly as if moving the cursor
Keep both hands within the camera frame
tips: Keeping the left-hand FIST firmly helps the right-hand movement stay stable.
Move smoothly with your whole arm rather than only your wrist.
pitfalls: If the left-hand FIST loosens, cursor movement may stop or cancel.
If either hand leaves the frame, recognition may be canceled.

gestures.name: LEFT FIST + RIGHT PINCH
howTo: Keep your left hand in a clear FIST
Pinch clearly and briefly with your right thumb and index finger (PINCH)
After clicking, relax your hand naturally
tips: A short and clear PINCH is best for clicking.
Make sure the fingertips touch clearly during the PINCH.
pitfalls: If the left-hand FIST loosens, the click may be missed.
If the PINCH is weak or released too quickly, it may not be recognized.

gestures.name: FIST
howTo: Keep a clear fist shape
Hold for at least 0.3 seconds to be recognized
tips: Recognition is more stable when fingers are fully folded.
pitfalls: A half-closed hand may be misrecognized as another gesture.

gestures.name: PINCH
howTo: Pinch firmly with your thumb and index finger
PINCH over the selected key
tips: Keep the PINCH short and clear.
pitfalls: A weak pinch may cause missed inputs.

gestures.name: PINCH
gestures.action: PINCH start: pen down / Release: pen up
howTo: Pinch firmly with your thumb and index finger
Move your hand while pinching to draw lines
Release to stop drawing
tips: Keeping pinch strength consistent stabilizes the line.
Moving too fast may break the line.
pitfalls: A weak pinch may be misrecognized as a click or move.
It can be confused with mouse drag—check the DRAW mode indicator.

gestures.name: OPEN_PALM
howTo: Open your palm facing the camera
Move slowly near the center of the frame
tips: Moving smoothly with your whole arm improves stability.
If lines shake, try adjusting sensitivity/smoothing settings.
pitfalls: If fingers bend, it may be recognized as another gesture.

gestures.name: V + V
howTo: Keep both hands within the camera frame
Make a V shape with both hands (index + middle fingers)
Hold briefly (about 0.3–0.5 seconds)
tips: Both hands must be recognized at the same time to start.
Keeping a wider V angle improves recognition.
pitfalls: If only one hand is recognized, it may not start.
If fingers overlap, it may be misrecognized as PINCH.

gestures.name: V + V
gestures.action: Open the mode map (mode selection UI)
howTo: Keep both hands within the camera frame
Make a V shape with both hands (index + middle fingers)
Hold briefly (about 0.3–0.5 seconds)
tips: Both hands must be recognized at the same time to open the mode map.
pitfalls: This gesture is the same as Start Motion, so behavior may differ depending on the app state (READY/LIVE, etc.).

gestures.name: FIST + FIST
howTo: Make a FIST with both hands and hold
Keep both hands within the camera frame
Hold briefly (about 0.3–0.5 seconds)
tips: Make sure both fists are clearly formed to avoid misfires.
pitfalls: If held too briefly, the stop action may be missed.
If either hand leaves the frame, recognition may be canceled.

gestures.name: FIST (Hold)
gestures.action: Toggle lock for all gesture inputs
howTo: Hold a FIST for a set duration
When locked, gestures will not be recognized
tips: Useful for preventing unintended inputs.
It’s recommended to show a LOCKED badge in the UI when locked.
pitfalls: If the hold time is too short, lock may not activate.
If misfires happen often, increase the required hold time (e.g., 1.0s).

gestures.name: OPEN_PALM + OPEN_PALM
howTo: Keep both hands within the camera frame
Open both palms facing forward
tips: It won’t work if only one hand is recognized.
pitfalls: If your hands leave the frame, recognition may be canceled.

gestures.name: OPEN_PALM
howTo: Move with your palm open
tips: Used to select links or buttons during PPT.
pitfalls: Moving too fast may cause the cursor to jump.

gestures.name: PINCH
howTo: Perform a short and clear PINCH
tips: Use mostly short gestures.
pitfalls: Holding too long may be misrecognized as another gesture.

gestures.name: FIST
howTo: Make a fist with the cursor hand
tips: In PPT mode, FIST is dedicated to slide control.
pitfalls: If too short, it may not be recognized.

gestures.name: V
howTo: Spread your index and middle fingers to form a V shape
tips: Keep a wide V angle.
pitfalls: If the angle is too narrow, it may be misrecognized as PINCH.

gestures.name: FIST + FIST (Hold)
howTo: Hold both hands as fists
tips: Hold longer to prevent misfires.
pitfalls: If held too briefly, it may not exit.

gestures.name: PINCH + PINCH (Hold)
howTo: Hold PINCH with both hands
tips: Useful for switching between PPT and a browser.
pitfalls: If too short, it may be recognized as a single click.
